results.title: Bellamy's Daintree: where reef meets rainforest
results.creator_credit: Australian Conservation Foundation and Wilderness Society
results.brief_description: David Bellamy shows how quickly our rainforests - the most diverse living system on land - are disappearing. He then catalogues the reasons why we should not be destroying our few remaining rainforests including genetic reserves retained in these forests.

results.title: Being right: can you still lose?
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Questions, Answers.”.
An excerpt from the feature ” Ride a wild pony”, which has an Australian setting. Conflict flares when two children claim ownership of a wild pony. A judge settles the dispute by allowing the pony to decide. The film centres on how the children cope with the decision. The aim of the film is to allow children to explore the concepts of winning and losing and how to deal with them. Suitable for middle and upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Being in: Life Be In It
results.brief_description: Examines the ‘Life Be In It’ campaign, its progress and the continued support it needs form members of the community, and advocates ways of becoming a part of the program. The ‘Life Be In It’ campaign was aimed at fostering community involvement in physical recreation, physical fitness and healthier lifestyles for all Australian.

results.title: Being in touch
results.brief_description: This film considers the topic of baby massage and its contribution to healthy child development. Takes a look at the importance given to baby massage in other cultures: India, Nigeria, Tahiti, as well as the growing recognition of baby massage in Australia. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Being and doing
results.brief_description: In this collaboration between one of Britain’s leading performance artists, Stuart Brisley and a major independent film-maker, records of Performance Art have been extensively manipulated; the images slowed down, fragmented, and details isolated to construct a filmic ‘memory’ of the events.

results.title: Behind the seams: designing and manufacturing clothing in Australia
results.creator_credit: Peter Wiseman and Video Education Australasia
results.brief_description: Not an expose on high fashion, but a look at how clothing is made in a modern mass production factory. The programme is intended to erase any pre-conceived ideas about the factory as a dangerous, unpleasant workplace. The viewer is shown the manufacturing process from concept and design, to the finished garment. Divided into two parts entitled, Fashion and design” and “The Factory floor.

results.title: Behind the scenes at Walt Disney studios
results.creator_credit: Alfred L Werker, Hamilton Luske and Walt Disney
results.brief_description: Humorist Robert Benchley visits the Disney Studios to sell Walt on the idea of animating the story of The Reluctant Dragon. While evading an officious young studio guide, Benchley stumbles into various studio activities and departments, including an art class, a sound effects session, the multiplane camera studio (at which point he notices the film has switched to Technicolor), the paint lab, a storyboard session for the “Baby Weems” segment, a movieola screening of the Goofy cartoon “How to Ride a Horse”, and finally catches up with Walt in a screening room just as he’s previewing the studio’s latest film… The Reluctant Dragon! Cinematography by Bert Glennon and Winton C. Hock. Edited by Paul Weatherwax.

results.title: Behaviour patterns and survival
results.brief_description: Depicts the behaviour of the Slaty Backed Gull. Types of chick behaviour, innate and learned are shown by response to parent’s voice. Originally in Japanese - dubbed into English. Suitable for Mid-Upper Secondary level students.

results.title: Beginnings - Inspiration - the Role of the Writer
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Writers on Writing”.
This series is based on a growing archive of video material of conversations between contemporary writers discussing their work. The material has been re-edited to form a resource for students and teachers of English, and each of the six twenty-minute videos focuses on different aspects and stages of the writing process. Each video is accompanied by a resource booklet. In this video, writers talk about how they began to write, what their inspiration is and their perception of the writer’s role.

results.title: Beginning tumbling
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tumbling”.
By regular and slow-motion demonstration, accompanied by a simple explanatory commentary, the following tumbling starts are taught: forward roll, dive to forward roll, three men sideward roll, stand, hand walk, cartwheel, round-off and combinations.
